brief_description of the content in the: The source URL provides information about a rule that reports standard getter methods in Java that can be replaced by the Lombok @Getter annotation. The rule only applies when the Lombok library is configured in the project. The page also provides a link to the Lombok site for more information on how to unlombok.
generated_rule_explanation from GPT-4: The rule 'lombok-getter-may-be-used' checks all classes in the project. For each class, it checks all methods. If a method's name starts with 'get' and the class does not have the Lombok @Getter annotation, it asserts that the return type of the method is the same as the type of the method. If the assertion fails, it generates a message indicating that the standard getter method can be replaced by the Lombok @Getter annotation.
3rd-party most relevant URLs and summary:
1. URL: https://projectlombok.org/features/Getter
Summary: This page provides detailed information about the Lombok @Getter annotation, including how to use it and its benefits in reducing boilerplate code in Java.

2. URL: https://www.baeldung.com/intro-to-project-lombok
Summary: This page provides a comprehensive introduction to Project Lombok, including its setup, various annotations like @Getter, and how it helps in reducing verbose code in Java.
